posts.com:
>>29128545
>from what I've seen Krait gets a 30-50% increase at the same clock compared to the old A9
If we're talking raw performance, then it's more like a ~60% increase. Krait can do 3.3DMPIS/MHz, and Cortex A9 can do 2.5DMPIS/MHz.
The Nexus 4 has a 25% higher clock frequency though, and twice the amount of cores. All that should add up to twice the performance, if not more.
If you look at Linkpack benchmarks, which can be set to only run 1 thread, then you'd see that Krait at 1.5GHz is more than twice as fast as a 1.2GHz Cortex A9 (Tegra 3 in the tests I have looked at).

There are already lots of program which can take advantage of more than 2 cores on Android. MX Video player is one of them, and I am pretty sure Chrome can do it as well.

As for the GPU, the Nexus 4 utterly destroys the Galaxy nexus in that category. Hell, even my Galaxy S 2 destroys the Galaxy nexus in that category, and it's almost 2 years old now.

posts.com:
>>29129012
>Also how is the international version better if the US version is sporting the Krait?
Dual core Krait at 1.5 vs Quad core A9 at 1.4 GHz.
Krait is not quite twice as powerful (like I said before, it's "only" about 60% faster clock for clock) so in terms of raw performance the international one is faster (for like, movie watching if you're using software decoding, like with Hi10p content).
For general tasks and apps, the Krait will probably be faster.
Not sure about the GPU though. Too tired to look that up.

HERE WE GO AGAIN X4
alright /g/ it’s hurting me to see you struggle like this over all these years, so rather than just treat this as a comedy board as usual I'm going to give you some actual knowledge:

THE ONLY FEATURE THAT MATTERS ON THE LATEST GENERATION OF CELL PHONES IS: ...battery life

Your phones features don't mean shit if your phones dead before an 8 hour work day!
I've ready countless threads about which snap dragon dildo processor or rectum retina display you need or you just don't know shit about technology- NO. all new phones run the latest apps, they all browse relatively quickly on your respective network.

But if you purchase a dead beat battery phone you're disqualified.
Don’t care about its feature, don't care about the price, don't care about the contract, if its off, its useless to me.

I'll let /g/ get back to ranting and raving over the next best i52500k cyber sex Monday /g/eentoo OS or whatever the buzzwords are these days now.
